Title: Evaluating the limit of a sqrt function using Riemann Sums
Question:
$\lim\limits_{n\to\infty}\dfrac{\sqrt1+\sqrt2+\sqrt3+\ldots+\sqrt n}{n\sqrt n}$

I am having trouble doing this problem. I have attempted to take the Riemann Sum but cannot get past the square root. I also tried to upper-bound and lower-bound it, but I got stuck doing this.
